title: Typophile
content:
**[Indices](http://web.archive.org/web/20131010193140/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Indices) : [Terminology](http://web.archive.org/web/20131010193140/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Terminology) : Typophile**

Strictly speaking, a fanatic of all things [type](http://web.archive.org/web/20131010193140/http:/typophile.com/wiki/type)-related or [typographic](http://web.archive.org/web/20131010193140/http:/typophile.com/wiki/typography). In a broader sense, a lover of letters. This looser definition encompasses writing and lettering as areas of interest. See also [typophilism](http://web.archive.org/web/20131010193140/http:/typophile.com/wiki/typophilism).

**[Indices](http://web.archive.org/web/20131010193140/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Indices) : [Organizations](http://web.archive.org/web/20131010193140/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Organizations) : Typophile**

[Typophile](http://web.archive.org/web/20131010193140/http:/www.typophile.com/) launched 16 April 2000. Typophile originally launched with exclusive articles and online courses from [Jonathan Hoefler](http://web.archive.org/web/20131010193140/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Jonathan%20Hoefler) based on his [Yale](http://web.archive.org/web/20131010193140/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Yale) lectures as well as articles from [Three Island Press](http://web.archive.org/web/20131010193140/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Three%20Island%20Press) and [TypeRight](http://web.archive.org/web/20131010193140/http:/typophile.com/wiki/TypeRight).

Typophile's stated aim is to further [typography](http://web.archive.org/web/20131010193140/http:/typophile.com/wiki/typography) as a craft as well as a profession by providing an open, collaborative environment where users can contribute and access content for free. In the Typophile Forums members discuss everything from how to pronounce [Benguiat](http://web.archive.org/web/20131010193140/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Edward%20Benguiat) to writing [pangrams](http://web.archive.org/web/20131010193140/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Pangram) or just getting help identifying a [typeface](http://web.archive.org/web/20131010193140/http:/typophile.com/wiki/typeface).

Aspiring and professional [type designers](http://web.archive.org/web/20131010193140/http:/typophile.com/wiki/type%20designers) post their work for peer critique. Currently there are over 500 fonts by designers from all over the world where English is commonly spoken -- North America, South America, Europe and Russia.

Typophile is produced, designed and maintained by [Punchcut](http://web.archive.org/web/20131010193140/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Punchcut) ( [www.punchcut.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20131010193140/http:/www.punchcut.com/)), a San Francisco based interface design company. Typophile members, film fest sponsors and advertisers provide the sustaining financial support to keep Typophile thriving.

TYPOPHILE FILM FEST

In 2004 Typophile started the [Typophile Film Fest](http://web.archive.org/web/20131010193140/http:/www.typophile.com/filmfest/) with the debut showing held at [TypeCon](http://web.archive.org/web/20131010193140/http:/typophile.com/wiki/TypeCon) 2004 in San Francisco. It has since been shown in New York, Boston, Seattle, St Petersburg and Vancouver.

Typophile has been featured in _[Tupigraphia](http://web.archive.org/web/20131010193140/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Tupigraphia), [Metropolis](http://web.archive.org/web/20131010193140/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Metropolis), [Applied Arts Magazine](http://web.archive.org/web/20131010193140/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Applied%20Arts%20Magazine), [STEP](http://web.archive.org/web/20131010193140/http:/typophile.com/wiki/STEP)_ and _[How](http://web.archive.org/web/20131010193140/http:/typophile.com/wiki/How)_.
